ratings.comment: Nevine was a great professor who knew her content well. Her grading of written assignments was light and she offered lots of feedback. I would definitely recommend Nevine for any French class, just make sure to participate in class!

I took Fre285 Fall 23 and loved it! I thought Nevine was a great professor who really understood the readings and films and lectured about them in a way that helped me understand. There were a lot of writing assignments but they were beneficial and she always gave super great detailed feedback- fair grading on writing assignments imo also.

Nevine is a very nice woman but definitely assigns a lot of homework. There was a homework assignment practically every class, some which included watching long movies or reading confusing books. However, she is very knowledgable and has good analysis on the books. There were two papers & midterm & final. Keep up with the work and you'll do well.

Somewhat different because I took her class while we were both abroad in Paris. Her character and personality is great! Super funny and caring person. Her papers and exams were very reasonable and incorporated both readings and lecture material. Not all readings are required though. The class was "Representation of Islam in French Culture/Politics"

I absolutely LOVED Professor El-Nossery. She was so kind and really cared that students understood the material and could do well in class. I found her comments on my essays helpful and have come away a better writer. I also thought that the readings were very interesting and her lectures are fun. I would 100% recommend this class and professor :)

Her grading was completely illogical, and she changed many hw grades retrospectively through the semester. I was sick for a class and emailed her but she still took points off of my participation (which is a high % of the grade). Too much hw for a 3 credit class. She's rude about class participation as well as hard to pay attention to (she rambles)

I really liked Professor El-Nossery. I was intimidated by her at first, but she is pretty chill and good-humored. I think she makes class really interesting with the variety of readings and subjects that she has us discuss. The grammar part of the class was typical of any French class, so definitely study that!

Okay so here's the thing- her grading is completely random and makes no sense, which makes completing assignments nearly impossible. Participation matters a lot, but the way that she grades participation is entirely illogical, and doesn't really have a system. I would NOT recommend her or any of her classes to you. Seriously. Chose a different one

Fine. Fairly nice person, just show up and participate and you'll be good for the most part. Class is mostly discussion in French. Assigns daily HW but never collects it, more just for discussion purposes. Sometimes gives short writing assignments. Decent, unremarkable.

I really enjoyed this class (perfect for an upper-level lit credit) and Nevine as a lecturer. She was obviously passionate about the topics we discussed from the readings and always wanted to hear what we had to say. Grade consists of participation, a few essay quizzes, a midterm, and a final presentation/paper. Overall great class and great prof!

Nevine is a thoughtful lecturer--she pushed us to think and brought out new ideas from our readings. Class was discussion heavy--so make sure you come prepared and unafraid to participate. She's super sweet and understanding. When I got a concussion and emailed her last minute about my injuries, she gave me extensions on every upcoming assignment!

Nevine's test load is manageable for 271 without a final or any "huge" exams. You've got a lot of opportunities to show her what you know and a great deal of your grade is based on participation and showing her you've read and care.  She's nice and always available to help but sometimes hard to follow because she's got a baaaaad case of monotone.

Nevine is a tough professor who expects a lot from her students. That said, I think she pushes her students because she really wants them to grow and learn. Overall she's really nice (though a bit intimidating at first), and the discussions in class were very interesting. I would not expect an easy "A" from her!

I did not learn anything in this class. She expected us to know how to analyze difficult french literature right off the bat and downgraded us if we did not analyze it the way she wants. Would not recommend.
Very nice teacher, extremely helpful and overall a great class experience.

Great course with a great professor. Make sure you keep up on the readings and set aside some of your favorites to look back on to help with essay topic selection. It's not the easiest class ever but is worthwhile because of the opportunities being in the class presents.

Nevine speaks insightfully and intelligently on the topic of Islam in French Society, particularly concerning women in Muslim societies.  This FIG course involves multimedia, which is far more educational than pure textbook reading.  The curriculum is diversified across many facets of French society and colonies, so it's not just a one-topic class
She was very interesting and helpful, although she had a strong opinion on everything. Very glad to have taken this class. Keep an open mind and make sure to keep up on the readings.
